messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> On 11/29/05, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
> >
> > Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> >
> > > Which, if I'm not mistaken, would require... dependent methods (being
> > able
> > > to order the tests).
> >
> > You are mistaken. :) It wouldn't require it; I don't mind if both tests
> > fail for the same reason, although I might be concerned if 10 tests
> > failed for the same reason. In the latter case, there's a design issue I
> > need to work on.
>
>
> Why work on it if the testing framework can do it for you?
>
> Without dependent methods: "10 FAILURES".
>
> With dependent methods: "1 FAILURE, 9 SKIPS".
>
> I know which result I prefer :-)

Does the framework figure out and maintain which tests depend on which?

We /all/ know which result you prefer.

When it comes time to eliminate the dependency, I don't want to have to
undo all those annotations. I might not even know when or how I
eliminated the dependency! Then I'd be skipping tests for no reason.
